Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/deployment.html)

If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

Post.title: CentOS  Kubernetes
Post._content:
## 

- :
  - CentOS 7
  - RHEL 7
-  2 GB  RAM ()
- 2 CPU 
- ()
- MAC product_uuid[](http://localhost:1313/zh/docs/setup/independent/install-kubeadm/#verify-the-mac-address-and-product-uuid-are-unique-for-every-node) 
- . [](http://localhost:1313/zh/docs/setup/independent/install-kubeadm/#check-required-ports)
-  Swap  kubelet  **** 

###  MAC  product_uuid 

-  MAC `ip link`  `ifconfig -a`
-  product_uuid `sudo cat /sys/class/dmi/id/product_uuid`

Kubernetes [](https://github.com/kubernetes/kubeadm/issues/31)

### 

 Kubernetes  IP  Kubernetes 

### 

#### Master 

|  |     |   |                     |                |
| :--- | :------ | :-------- | :---------------------- | :------------------- |
| TCP  | Inbound | 6443*     | Kubernetes API server   | All                  |
| TCP  | Inbound | 2379-2380 | etcd server client API  | kube-apiserver, etcd |
| TCP  | Inbound | 10250     | Kubelet API             | Self, Control plane  |
| TCP  | Inbound | 10251     | kube-scheduler          | Self                 |
| TCP  | Inbound | 10252     | kube-controller-manager | Self                 |

#### Worker 

|  |     |     |                 |               |
| :--- | :------ | :---------- | :------------------ | :------------------ |
| TCP  | Inbound | 10250       | Kubelet API         | Self, Control plane |
| TCP  | Inbound | 30000-32767 | NodePort Services** | All                 |

`**` [NodePort ](http://localhost:1313/docs/concepts/services-networking/service/) 

 `*` 

 etcd  etcd   pod  ()  pod 

###  kubeadm, kubelet  kubectl



- `kubeadm`: 
- `kubelet`:  pod  container 
- `kubectl`: 

kubeadm ****  `kubelet`  `kubectl`  kubeadm  Kubernetes  kubelet  **  kubelet  API server  1.8.0  API server  1.7.0  kubelet

```bash
cat <<EOF > /etc/yum.repos.d/kubernetes.repo
[kubernetes]
name=Kubernetes
baseurl=https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/repos/kubernetes-el7-x86_64
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
repo_gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/doc/yum-key.gpg https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/doc/rpm-package-key.gpg
exclude=kube*
EOF

#  SELinux  permissive ()
setenforce 0
sed -i 's/^SELINUX=enforcing$/SELINUX=permissive/' /etc/selinux/config

yum install -y kubelet kubeadm kubectl --disableexcludes=kubernetes

systemctl enable kubelet && systemctl start kubelet
```

****

\-  `setenforce 0`  `sed ...`  SELinux  permissive ()  Pod  kubelet  SELinux  -  RHEL/CentOS 7  iptables   `sysctl`  `net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables` 1

```bash
cat <<EOF >  /etc/sysctl.d/k8s.conf
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1
EOF
sysctl --system
```

kubelet  kubeadm 

###  Master  kubelet  cgroup 

 Docker kubeadm  cgroup  `/var/lib/kubelet/kubeadm-flags.env`   CRI  `/etc/default/kubelet`  `cgroup-driver` 

```bash
KUBELET_EXTRA_ARGS=--cgroup-driver=<value>
```

 `kubeadm init`  `kubeadm join`  kubelet  

**** cgroup driver  `cgroupfs`  `cgroupfs`  kubelet 

 kubelet

```bash
systemctl daemon-reload
systemctl restart kubelet
```

#  kubeadm 

###

Post.title: pipenv
Post._content:
## 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) Python Development Workflow for Humans Python  requests  kennethreitz  Python  Python 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) pip  virtualenv virtualenv Pipenv 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)

- [Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) virtualenv  pipenv shell 
-  requirements.txt  [Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) Pipfile  Pipfile.lock  Pipfile  Pipfile  Pipfile.lock 
-  Hash 
-  Python  pipenv graph 
-  .env 

## 

`pip install pipenv`

## 

### 1. 

`pipenv`  python  `pipenv --python 2.7`

### 2. 

```shell
pipenv intall flask                     # 
pipenv install 'flask==1.0.2'           # 
pipenv install 'pylint<2.0.0' --dev     # 
pipenv install -r requirements.txt      # requirements.txt

pipenv install                          # clonePipfile.lockPipfile.lock
```

****

```shell
pipenv uninstall
pipenv uninstall flask
```

### 3. 

```shell
pipenv graph          # 
pipenv run pip list
```

`pipenv graph` 

```shell
requests==2.19.1
  - certifi [required: >=2017.4.17, installed: 2018.8.24]
  - chardet [required: >=3.0.2,<3.1.0, installed: 3.0.4]
  - idna [required: >=2.5,<2.8, installed: 2.7]
  - urllib3 [required: >=1.21.1,<1.24, installed: 1.23]
```

### 4.  Pipfile.lock 

```shell
pipenv lock
pipenv update   # 
pipenv sync     # 
```

### 5.  requirements.txt 

`pipenv lock -r >requirements.txt`

### 6. 

```shell
pipenv shell             # 
pipenv --where           # 
pipenv --venv            # 
pipenv --py              # python
pipenv --envs            # 
```

## 

### 1.  python 

`pipenv --python 2.7`

### 2. 

 `Pipfile` 

```toml
[[source]]
url = "https://pypi.doubanio.com/simple"
verify_ssl = true
name = "douban"
```

### 3. / `Pipfile.lock` 

`pipenv update`

### 4. _() / requirements.txt _

`pipenv lock -r > requirements.txt`

## 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) Python Development Workflow for Humans Python  requests  kennethreitz  Python  Python 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) pip  virtualenv virtualenv Pipenv 

[Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)

- [Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) virtualenv  pipenv shell 
-  requirements.txt  [Pipenv](https://pipenv.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) Pipfile  Pipfile.lock  Pipfile  Pipfile  Pipfile.lock 
-  Hash 
-  Python  pipenv graph 
-  .env 

## 

`pip install pipenv`

## 

### 1. 

`pipenv`  python  `pipenv --python 2.7`

### 2. 

```shell
pipenv intall flask                     # 
pipenv install 'flask==1.0.2'           # 
pipenv install 'pylint<2.0.0' --dev     # 
pipenv install -r requirements.txt      # requirements.txt

pipenv install                          # clonePipfile.lockPipfile.lock
```

****

```shell
pipenv uninstall
pipenv uninstall flask
```

### 3. 

```shell
pipenv graph          # 
pipenv run pip list
```

`pipenv graph` 

```shell
requests==2.19.1
  - certifi [required: >=2017.4.17, installed: 2018.8.24]
  - chardet [required: >=3.0.2,<3.1.0, installed: 3.0.4]
  - idna [required: >=2.5,<2.8, installed: 2.7]
  - urllib3 [required: >=1.21.1,<1.24, installed: 1.23]
```

### 4.  Pipfile.lock 

```shell
pipenv lock
pipenv update   # 
pipenv sync     # 
```

### 5.  requirements.txt 

`pipenv lock -r >requirements.txt`

### 6. 

```shell
pipenv shell             # 
pipenv --where           # 
pipenv --venv            # 
pipenv --py              # python
pipenv --envs            # 
```

## 

### 1.  python 

`pipenv --python 2.7`

### 2. 

 `Pipfile` 

```toml
[[source]]
url = "https://pypi.doubanio.com/simple"
verify_ssl = true
name = "douban"
```

### 3. / `Pipfile.lock` 

`pipenv update`

### 4. _() / requirements.txt _

`pipenv lock -r > requirements.txt`
